p: The most common variety is Thymus vulgaris L. It belongs to the genus Thymus of the Lamiaceae family. The EO extracted from T. vulgaris EO showed antimicrobial activity against several phytopathogens such as B. cinerea, Penicillium italicum Wehmer, P. citrophthora Leonian, and Rhizopus stolonifer (Ehrenb.) Vuill. [ 37].
